intro: [WRONG START] Triteca, commonly known as the "three-lobed" plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Tritheca species are often found in dry, rocky habitats, showcasing their adaptability to arid environments. These plants play a role in supporting local pollinators and contribute to the ecological balance of their native regions.
